result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Return on doctor's report held. Parties review the report and do not contest the findings. Court adopts the findings of the report and finds that the defendant is not competent but likely to regain. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
filed.
filed.
signed and filed. Copy emailed to DHS.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for further proceedings. Competency hearing continues. Sworn for the Defense:  Dr. Collins.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Seipel and Dr. Collins,  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in their own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. 
Court orders case adjourned back to Branch 29.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for further proceedings. Defendant could not appear by Zoom for reasons placed on the record. Defense requests to have the defendant in court via Zoom for discussion on competency.
Case adjourned.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for competency hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. Seipel's report.  Defendant does challenge Dr. Seipel's report.  
Court qualified Dr. Seipel to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   Sworn for the State:  Dr. Matthew Seipel.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. 
Court reserves ruling until next hearing.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Richards Br 30. Parties notified and sent to room # 622, court house.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Return on doctor's report held. Parties review the report. Defense counsel requests a competency hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Parties request an adjourned return on doctor's report.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a return on doctor's report. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-28-2022, filed.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a calendar call. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-18-2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 3-16-2022, filed.
Calendar call on March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant not in court.  Katherine Seelow for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Calendar call scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-3-2022, filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JG (DOB 1/28/22)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fanta'Jia Jo'Neece Larie Grant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
